Class SocketServer

java.lang.Object
org.mio.progettoingsoft.network.server.socket.SocketServer
public class SocketServer extends Object
Manages the Socket server operations, including listening for incoming client connections and dispatching received messages for processing. This class sets up a server socket and spawns threads for each new client and for handling all incoming messages.

  • Constructor Details

    • SocketServer

      public SocketServer(ConnectionInfo connectionInfo)
      Constructs a new SocketServer. Initializes the BlockingQueue for messages, gets the singleton ServerController instance, and creates a ServerMessageHandler to process incoming messages.
      Parameters:
      connectionInfo - The ConnectionInfo object containing the server's network details.

  • Method Details

    • startServer

      public void startServer() throws IOException
      Starts the Socket server. This method performs the following actions:
      1. Creates a ServerSocket to listen for client connections on the configured port.
      2. Starts a dedicated thread for the ServerMessageHandler to asynchronously process messages placed in the receivedMessages queue. This thread is set as a daemon thread.
      3. Logs the server startup information.
      4. Enters an infinite loop to continuously accept new client connections.
      5. For each new client connection, it creates a SocketClientHandler and starts a new daemon thread to manage communication with that specific client.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs when opening the server socket or accepting connections.
